IPSerializer Class Reference

#include <IPSerializer.h>

void parse (const unsigned char *buf, unsigned int bufsize, IPDatagram *dest)

Detailed Description

Converts between IPDatagram and binary (network byte order) IP header.

Definition at line 27 of file IPSerializer.h.

Member Function Documentation

void IPSerializer::parse ( const unsigned char *  buf,
unsigned int  bufsize,
IPDatagram *  dest 
)

Puts a packet sniffed from the wire into an IPDatagram. Does NOT verify the checksum.

Definition at line 106 of file IPSerializer.cc.

00107 {
00108     const struct ip *ip = (const struct ip *) buf;
00109     unsigned int totalLength, headerLength;
00110 
00111     dest->setVersion(ip->ip_v);
00112     dest->setHeaderLength(IP_HEADER_BYTES);
00113     dest->setSrcAddress(ntohl(ip->ip_src.s_addr));
00114     dest->setDestAddress(ntohl(ip->ip_dst.s_addr));
00115     dest->setTransportProtocol(ip->ip_p);
00116     dest->setTimeToLive(ip->ip_ttl);
00117     dest->setIdentification(ntohs(ip->ip_id));
00118     dest->setMoreFragments((ip->ip_off) & !IP_OFFMASK & IP_MF);
00119     dest->setDontFragment((ip->ip_off) & !IP_OFFMASK & IP_DF);
00120     dest->setFragmentOffset((ntohs(ip->ip_off)) & IP_OFFMASK);
00121     dest->setDiffServCodePoint(ip->ip_tos);
00122     totalLength = ntohs(ip->ip_len);
00123     headerLength = ip->ip_hl << 2;
00124 
00125     if (headerLength > (unsigned int)IP_HEADER_BYTES)
00126         EV << "Handling an captured IP packet with options. Dropping the options.\n";
00127     if (totalLength > bufsize)
00128         EV << "Can not handle IP packet of total length " << totalLength << "(captured only " << bufsize << " bytes).\n";
00129     dest->setByteLength(IP_HEADER_BYTES);
00130 
00131     cPacket *encapPacket = NULL;
00132     switch (dest->getTransportProtocol())
00133     {
00134       case IP_PROT_ICMP:
00135         encapPacket = new ICMPMessage("icmp-from-wire");
00136         ICMPSerializer().parse(buf + headerLength, std::min(totalLength, bufsize) - headerLength, (ICMPMessage *)encapPacket);
00137         break;
00138       case IP_PROT_UDP:
00139         encapPacket = new UDPPacket("udp-from-wire");
00140         UDPSerializer().parse(buf + headerLength, std::min(totalLength, bufsize) - headerLength, (UDPPacket *)encapPacket);
00141         break;
00142       case IP_PROT_SCTP:
00143         encapPacket = new SCTPMessage("sctp-from-wire");
00144         SCTPSerializer().parse(buf + headerLength, (unsigned int)(std::min(totalLength, bufsize) - headerLength), (SCTPMessage *)encapPacket);
00145         break;
00146       case IP_PROT_TCP:
00147         encapPacket = new TCPSegment("tcp-from-wire");
00148         TCPSerializer().parse(buf + headerLength, (unsigned int)(std::min(totalLength, bufsize) - headerLength), (TCPSegment *)encapPacket);
00149         break;
00150       default:
00151         opp_error("IPSerializer: cannot serialize protocol %d", dest->getTransportProtocol());
00152     }
00153 
00154     ASSERT(encapPacket);
00155     dest->encapsulate(encapPacket);
00156     dest->setName(encapPacket->getName());

int IPSerializer::serialize ( const IPDatagram *  dgram,
unsigned char *  buf,
unsigned int  bufsize 
)

Serializes an IPDatagram for transmission on the wire. The checksum is NOT filled in. (The kernel does that when sending the frame over a raw socket.) Returns the length of data written into buffer.

Definition at line 56 of file IPSerializer.cc.

00057 {
00058     int packetLength;
00059     struct ip *ip = (struct ip *) buf;
00060 
00061     ip->ip_hl         = IP_HEADER_BYTES >> 2;
00062     ip->ip_v          = dgram->getVersion();
00063     ip->ip_tos        = dgram->getDiffServCodePoint();
00064     ip->ip_id         = htons(dgram->getIdentification());
00065     ip->ip_off        = htons(dgram->getFragmentOffset());
00066     ip->ip_ttl        = dgram->getTimeToLive();
00067     ip->ip_p          = dgram->getTransportProtocol();
00068     ip->ip_src.s_addr = htonl(dgram->getSrcAddress().getInt());
00069     ip->ip_dst.s_addr = htonl(dgram->getDestAddress().getInt());
00070     ip->ip_sum        = 0;
00071 
00072     if (dgram->getHeaderLength() > IP_HEADER_BYTES)
00073         EV << "Serializing an IP packet with options. Dropping the options.\n";
00074 
00075     packetLength = IP_HEADER_BYTES;
00076 
00077     cMessage *encapPacket = dgram->getEncapsulatedMsg();
00078     switch (dgram->getTransportProtocol())
00079     {
00080       case IP_PROT_ICMP:
00081         packetLength += ICMPSerializer().serialize(check_and_cast<ICMPMessage *>(encapPacket),
00082                                                    buf+IP_HEADER_BYTES, bufsize-IP_HEADER_BYTES);
00083         break;
00084       case IP_PROT_UDP:
00085         packetLength += UDPSerializer().serialize(check_and_cast<UDPPacket *>(encapPacket),
00086                                                    buf+IP_HEADER_BYTES, bufsize-IP_HEADER_BYTES);
00087         break;
00088       case IP_PROT_SCTP:    //I.R.
00089         packetLength += SCTPSerializer().serialize(check_and_cast<SCTPMessage *>(encapPacket),
00090                                                    buf+IP_HEADER_BYTES, bufsize-IP_HEADER_BYTES);
00091         break;
00092       case IP_PROT_TCP:        //I.R.
00093         packetLength += TCPSerializer().serialize(check_and_cast<TCPSegment *>(encapPacket),
00094                                                    buf+IP_HEADER_BYTES, bufsize-IP_HEADER_BYTES,
00095                                                    dgram->getSrcAddress(), dgram->getDestAddress());
00096         break;
00097       default:
00098         opp_error("IPSerializer: cannot serialize protocol %d", dgram->getTransportProtocol());
00099     }
00100 
00101     ip->ip_len = htons(packetLength);
00102 
00103     return packetLength;
00104 }
